title: What to Read This Week
sub_head: Marie Curie’s life in science, a Depression-era tour of the United States, the trial of Jack Ruby, Daniel Silva’s new Gabriel Allon thriller and more.
body:
She was one of very few people to have won two Nobel Prizes, the first for the physics of radioactivity, the second for the chemistry of radium. Review by Andrew Crumey
Read the review
Lawyers for Jack Ruby, the man who killed Lee Harvey Oswald, claimed their client suffered from a rare form of epilepsy that rendered him unaware of his actions. Review by Edward Kosner
Read the review
